intro: Keckiella rothrockii var. jacintensis, commonly known as the jacintensis variant of Keckiella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to its native habitat.
